SMM4H’s documentation!¶

CNN¶

class smm4h.cnn.CNN(x_train, y_train, embedding_matrix, x_val, y_val, labels, dim, maxlen, maxwords, filter_length, cross_val=True, x_test=None)¶

Runs CNN.

Parameters

  • x_train – X train data pre-processed

  • y_train – Y train data pre-processed

  • embedding_matrix – embedding ready for embedding layer

  • x_val – X validation data pre-processed

  • y_val – Y validation data pre-processed

  • labels – list of unique labels

  • dim – dimension of word embedding

  • maxlen – maximum input length of a tweet

  • maxwords – maximum words

  • filter_length – length of filter

  • cross_val – flag for cross validation

  • x_test – test data

cv(x_train_data, y_train_data, embedding_matrix, x_val, y_val, labels, X_data_test=None)¶

This function does the cross validation.

Parameters

  • x_train_data – processed X train data.

  • y_train_data – processed Y train data.

  • embedding_matrix – embedding perpared for embedding layer.

  • x_val – processed X validation data.

  • y_val – processed Y validation data.

  • labels – list of labels.

param X_data_test: processed test data.

cv_evaluation_fold(y_pred, y_true, labels)¶

Evaluation metrics for emicroach fold

Parameters

  • y_pred – predicted labels

  • y_true – true labels

  • labels – list of the classes

Returns

fold stats

fit_Model(model, x_train, y_train)¶

fit the defined model to train on the data

Parameters

  • model – trained model

  • x_train – training data

  • y_train – training labels

Returns

model and loss & accuracy stats

predict(model, x_test, y_test, encoder_classes)¶

Takes the predictions as input and returns the indices of the maximum values along an axis using numpy argmax function as true labels. Then evaluates it against the trained model

Parameters

  • model – trained model

  • x_test – test data

  • y_test – test true labels

  • encoder_classes –

Returns

predicted and true labels

prediction_to_label(prediction)¶

Turns the prediction into a label.

Parameters

prediction – prediction for X data

Returns

labels in dictionary form

Model¶

class smm4h.model.Model(Xdata_train, Ydata_train, Xdata_val, Ydata_val, maxwords, maxlen, data_test=None)¶

Prepares data for CNN

Parameters

  • Xdata_train – preprocessed X train data

  • Ydata_train – preprocessed Y train data

  • Xdata_val – preprocessed X validation data

  • Ydata_val – preprocessed Y validation data

  • maxwords – maximum words to use

  • maxlen – maximum input length for tweet

  • data_test – preprocessed test data

get_features(text_series, tokenizer)¶

Transforms text data to feature_vectors that can be used in the ml model. tokenizer must be available.

Parameters

  • text_series – text to create sequences from

  • tokenizer – scikit learn tokenizer that has been fitted to text

Returns

padded sequences

process_test(data_test)¶

Prepares test data for model.

Parameters

data_test – CSV of test data read in via the read_from_file function

Returns

X test data prepared for model

process_train(Xdata_train, Ydata_train)¶

Reads in X data and formats it correctly.

Parameters

  • Xdata_train – CSV file of X train data read in via the read_from_file function

  • Ydata_train – CSV file of Y train data read in via the read_from_file function

Returns

X & Y train data, word_index, labels

process_val(Xdata_val, Ydata_val)¶

Prepares validation data for model.

Parameters

  • Xdata_val – CSV file of X validation data read in via the read_from_file function

  • Ydata_val – CSV file of Y validation data read in via the read_from_file function

Returns

X&Y validation data ready for model

Embedding¶

class smm4h.embedding.MakeEmbedding(word_index, embedding, dim, maxwords, error_handling=False)¶

Creates embedding for CNN

Parameters

  • word_index – word_index from model file

  • embedding – path to embedding file

  • dim – dimension of the embedding

  • maxwords – maximum number of words to use

  • error_handling – flag for embedding read function that handles errors

init_embedding()¶

function that creates embedding matrix from word_index.

Parameters

word_index – word index of X data

Returns

embedding matrix

read_embeddings_from_file(path)¶

Function to read external embedding files to build an index mapping words (as strings) to their vector representation (as number vectors).

Parameters

path – path to emebedding

Return dictionary

word vectors

read_embeddings_from_file_error_handling(path)¶

Function to read external embedding files to build an index mapping words (as strings) to their vector representation (as number vectors). Works exactly the same as def read_embeddings_from_file except has addional error handling for some embeddings that are tricky to read.

Parameters

path – path to emebedding

Return dictionary

word vectors

Preprocessing¶

class smm4h.preprocessing.Preprocessing(file)¶
remove_punctuation(tweets)¶

Removes double quotes

Parameters

tweets – list of tweets

Returns

tweets in list with double quotes removed

replace_emojis(tweets)¶

Remove emojis and replace them with word that represents them

Parameters

tweets – list of tweets

Returns

tweets in list with emojis replaced

replace_usernames(tweets)¶

Replaces usernames with word username

Parameters

tweets – list of tweets

Returns

tweets in list with usernames replaced

Unbalanced¶

class smm4h.unbalanced.Unbalanced(X, Y, unbalanced, multiplier=None, ratio1=None, ratio2=None, ratio1_label=None, ratio2_label=None)¶

Oversamples or desamples data.

Parameters

  • X – path to X data

  • Y – path to Y data

  • unbalanced – flag for desample, oversample or none. Four options: desample, oversample, weights, none.

  • multiplier – number to duplicate by for oversampling. 1 more than duplications desired.

  • ratio1 – ratio desired for first label

  • ratio2 – ratio desired for second label

  • ratio1_label – first label

  • ratio2_label – second label

desample(sentences, labels)¶

Desamples.

Parameters

  • labels – array of labels

  • sentences – array of sentences

Returns

desampled sentences, desampled labels

oversample(labels, sentences)¶

Oversamples.

Parameters

  • labels – array of labels

  • sentences – array of sentences

Returns

oversampled sentences, oversampled labels
